body: Doing a manual downgrade to 14.12.9 seems to fix it.

Also facing this issue since chef 15.0.293 was released today. How did you manage a manual downgrade? 

Every time I run `vagrant provision` it reinstalls the latest chef again.

I want to make it reproducible though with every vagrant up, this solution worked for me:

Install the omnibus plugin
`vagrant plugin install vagrant-omnibus`

then add this line to your Vagrantfile
`config.omnibus.chef_version = '14.12.9'`

Taken from here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11325479/how-to-control-the-version-of-chef-that-vagrant-uses-to-provision-vms

Hey all - It looks like there's a way to install a specific version, but it looks like it was never actually hooked up with the chef-solo provisioner. I also noticed that apparently this very important page on how to use the provisioners is buried in the docs instead of a link on the nav bar: https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/provisioning/chef_common.html

I just tried to use the version option and it looks like Vagrant ignored it. If I manually go in and change the version myself it seems to install the right version...so the fix shouldn't be too bad :crossed_fingers: 

I'll mark this as an enhancement to get this all cleaned up. Thanks for the report!

rename.to: chef-solo provisioner ignores common options for Chef installation

body:
Oops, sorry. I had an extra `"chef_solo"` provisioner in my config and that's why I saw that behavior. SO I was wrong, it is already hooked up and working. Something like this should work:

```ruby
chef.vm.provision :chef_solo do |c|
      c.add_recipe "test"
      c.version = "14.12.9"
end
```

__Edit:__ Note that the recipe option is just an example, you should only have to set the `version` option.

```
==> chef: Running provisioner: chef_solo...
    chef: Installing Chef (14.12.9)...
```

I'll try to make a PR to make those docs more discoverable though.

Hi Team

I'm also facing the same issue, even if I lock the chef version in Vagrantfile, latest version of chef only installed in the machine.

**Vagrantfile Config for Chef-Solo:**
#config.omnibus.chef_version = :latest
config.omnibus.chef_version = '14.12.9'
config.vm.provision "chef_solo" do |chef|
#chef.arguments = "chef-license=accept"
chef.version = "14.12.9"
chef.cookbooks_path = "C:\\devstack\\windows_10_client_pro_rs4_64_eng_vmware\\cookbook\\test"
chef.add_recipe "test"
chef.json = {
    "devstack" => {
      "JFROG_ARTIFACTORY_URL" => "https://artifactory-jfrog.com",
      "JFROG_ARTIFACTORY_API_KEY" => "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
    }
  }
end

**knife --version from machine**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39905551/57718042-1623d900-769a-11e9-8866-e0a27c03f33b.png)

**Console Message:**
==> default: Installing Chef 14.12.9 Omnibus package...
==> default: Downloading Chef 14.12.9 for Windows...
==> default: Installing Chef 14.12.9
==> default: Running provisioner: chef_solo...
    default: Installing Chef (14.12.9)...
Vagrant could not detect Chef on the guest! Even after Vagrant
attempted to install Chef, it could still not find Chef on the system.
Please make sure you are connected to the Internet and can access
Chef's package distribution servers. If you already have Chef
installed on this guest, you can disable the automatic Chef detection
by setting the 'install' option in the Chef configuration section of
your Vagrantfile:

    chef.install = false

@sharavanan2010 - That issue doesn't look related at all. It looks like it's installing the version you specified in the console message you shared. I recommend opening a new issue and provide the information requested in the new issue template, including a full debug log with the `--debug` flag.

rename.from: chef-solo provisioner ignores common options for Chef installation

body: @sharavanan2010 - also you're talking about chef, but you are looking at a different tool knife in your screenshot. If vagrant-omnibus is installing that, then you should open an issue with them.

@briancain Thanks for your quick response. How to check installed chef details?

I see this Cap:
https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/blob/v2.0.2/plugins/provisioners/chef/cap/windows/chef_installed.rb. 
From this logic, "knife --version" command is used to check chef installation status. Correct me if I'm wrong?

Initially we configured to install the latest version of chef,
config.omnibus.chef_version = :latest

From the latest chef release(15.0.293) today, vagrant up got failed and can't go back to working chef version.

@sharavanan2010 - It does look like that's the case. Still, I'm not sure how the `vagrant-omnibus` plugin works. I was able to properly install the correct requested version of chef with the `version` option like I mentioned above using the chef-solo provisioner.

```
vagrant@vagrant:~$ knife --version
Chef: 14.12.9
vagrant@vagrant:~$ chef-solo --version
Chef: 14.12.9
```
